title: Documentation to support the Decision Notice for planning application 20/03408/TPO

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please provide me with the documentation of the council’s reasoning or the delegated Officer Report that was used as supporting evidence to justify the Decision Notice for planning application 20/03408/TPO and felling of the T2 Lime tree.
If there is no supporting evidence regarding the Decision Notice, please explain how and why the decision was reached.
Yours faithfully,
Marika Szabo

Dear Markia Szabo,
Thank you for your request for information relating to 20/03408/TPO and
felling of the T2 Lime tree which we received on 11/12/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
The officer decision note is as follows:
Site visit on 18/12/2020 to assess application based on the following:
"t1 lime. lift lower epicormic growth and thin dense canopy to allow more
light in the garden
t2 lime. remove smaller one (of the three in question) to open up garden
and allow smaller fruit trees grow without being suppressed looks like old
avenue of trees as houses have surrounded them over the years the tree is
now in the wrong place and concerning the client as if it came down it may
hit the house.
t3 lime. lift lower epicormic growth and the thin canopy to allow more
light in the lower part of the garden."
Following a meeting with the resident to discuss the proposed works I have
no issue with the suggested works to T1 and T3. In fact having seen the
neighbouring trees included within the same TPO that have been reduced in
the past, they could be reduced by up to 2.5 m to further improve the
garden whilst maintaining sensible management of the trees. T2 is located
in the centre of the garden and has been suppressed by T1 and T3 leaving
it with a smaller tight crown between these two larger trees. This tree
could be removed to promote the crowns of T1 and T3 to become more uniform
whilst improving the garden for the resident. The removal of this tree
would not have a long-term detrimental effect on the treescape as T1 and
T3 will be improved as they have more space to grow. The lasting landscape
feature of the line of trees will also be retained if this one tree is
removed.
Will amend permission to:
T1 Lime. Remove lower epicormic growth and reduce in height by up to 3 m
from growing tips to a suitable growth point. Reduce laterally by up to
1.5 m from all growing tips to a suitable growth point.
T2 Lime. Fell to ground level.
T3 Lime. Remove lower epicormic growth and reduce in height by up to 3 m
from growing tips to a suitable growth point. Reduce laterally by up to
1.5 m from all growing tips to a suitable growth point.
GRANT as per above.
